sect3.title: Overview

figure.title: Example for the Line Nova filter

sect3.para: Line Nova command is a script which fills a layer with rays emanating outward from its center using the FG color. All lines radiates from the center of the layer. Rendered lines are cropped to be fit inside of the image.

tip.para: This filter does not provide any option which allow you to set the center point of lines. If you need adjust the center of starred-out lines where you want, create another transparent image and apply this filter on it, then add it on your image. Setting large size for the new nova image may help you not to break lines inside of your image.

sect3.title: Activating the filter
sect3.para:
This filter is found in the image window menu under
Filters Render Line Nova .

listitem.para: By using this slider you can set the number of lines between 40 to 1000. The default is 200.
Every line tapers off on outer limit. 0.0-10.0 The default is 1.0.
Almost lines don't reach the center point if this value is set over 0. You can set radius of the void space circle around the center point between 0 to 2000 pixels. Default value is 100 pixels.
